meanings.definition: A person who deceives or swindles others for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The fleecer tricked people into giving him money.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the fleecer who was scamming elderly citizens.
meanings.sent3: The fleecer thought he could outsmart everyone, but justice caught up with him.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his lies and manipulation, realizing he was a fleecer in disguise.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the smooth-talking fleecer who preys on unsuspecting victims.

meanings.sent2: The con artist fleecered innocent people out of their life savings.
meanings.sent3: The magician fleecered the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent4: She felt cheated when she realized he had fleecered her with false promises.
meanings.sent5: The salesman tried to fleecer the customer by selling a faulty product.
